title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 19
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's draw a regular polygon R with 2002 vertex along all of its diagonals. How many triangles that are formed that are of the vertex of R, but no side is the side of R?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 20
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A marathon competition is followed by four High Schools : Merak, Merpati, Pipit, and Walet. Each High School sends 5 runners. The runners who placed 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th will earn the points of consecutively: 7, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1. The points of each High School is the total of their 5 runners. The High School with the highest points is the winner. At the end, it was Pipit High School that was the winner and there are no two runners that finish at the same time. How many possibilities are there for the winning High School?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 4
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The real number 2.525252... is a rational number, so that it could be written in the form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac { m }{ n } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where m and n are integers, n â‰  0. If it is chosen the numbers m and n that are relatively prime, what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m\\quad +\\quad n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]}]}
